definition: with keen interest (idiom)/with great pleasure/with gusto/eagerly
saliva/sweat/a ferry crossing/a ford (river crossing)/abbr. for Tianjin 天津
saliva/sweat/a ferry crossing/a ford (river crossing)/abbr. for Tianjin 天津
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
taste/smell/(fig.) (noun suffix) feel/quality/sense/(TCM) classifier for ingredients of a medicine prescription

sentences.english: He turned to an editorial and began reading it with interest.
sentences.chinese: 他翻到裏面的一篇論文，津津有味地讀起來。

sentences.english: Chinese boys watch a cartoon at a toy fair in Beijing on July 29 2010.
sentences.chinese: 北京的玩具展會場中，兩小男孩津津有味地在看卡通。

sentences.english: Ray was so hungrythathe enjoyed every morsel of the stale bread.
sentences.chinese: 瑞因太飢餓了，所以津津有味地喫每一口乾硬的麪包。

sentences.english: The bird enjoyed a dinner of flatfish…
sentences.chinese: 小鳥先津津有味地吞進一條比目魚。

sentences.english: She was overjoyed and rewarded the redcoat with a goblet of wine, which he drank with relish.
sentences.chinese: 那女士高興極了，奉酒一杯，那英兵喝得津津有味。
克勞斯津津有味地體驗着世人的關注。

sentences.english: He takes great delight in eating lobster.
sentences.chinese: 他津津有味地喫着大龍蝦。

sentences.english: The teacher regaled the children with some fairy tales.
sentences.chinese: 老師講了些神話故事，孩子們聽得津津有味。

sentences.english: Yet Liu remembers her soldiering days with relish.
sentences.chinese: 然而，劉天佑回憶起那些日子仍然津津有味。

sentences.english: The villagers threw themselves into the ceremonies with gusto.
sentences.chinese: 村民們津津有味地圍觀儀式。

sentences.english: That would be Shaw, played with relish by Kevin Bacon.
sentences.chinese: 這將是邵氏，由凱文培根玩得津津有味。

sentences.english: He enjoyed his meal because it was on the cuff.
sentences.chinese: 因爲這頓飯不要錢，所以他喫得津津有味。

sentences.english: Families and young woman enjoyed fortunetelling games in the parlor.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子和年輕女子在客廳津津有味的玩着算命遊戲。

sentences.english: Hearn pulled off another piece of turkey and ate it with relish.
sentences.chinese: 候恩，又撕下一片火雞肉，喫得津津有味。

sentences.english: At this moment, I saw my father was holding a large watermelon eating with relish.
sentences.chinese: 這時，我看見爸爸正捧着大西瓜津津有味地喫着。

definition: to be fascinated/to be enchanted
to concentrate one's attention (idiom)
to become exhilarated (idiom); in high spirits/full of zest
lit. isn't that a joy? (quote from Confucius)/fig. (jocularly) extremely/awfully
smiles of exultation/radiant with delight
vigorously/energetically/enthusiastically
unable to take one's eyes off (idiom); to gaze steadily/to stare
engrossing
overjoyed (idiom); as pleased as punch
vivid and colorful (idiom); true to life/lively and realistic
flavorsome/(fig.) delightful/full of interest
lit. as if drunk and stupefied (idiom)/fig. intoxicated by sth/obsessed with/mad about sth
to sway to and fro/to rock back and forth
to be enthralled/to be entranced
to wish to continue sth/to have not fully expressed oneself
(onom.) smacking the lips
